review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: Did you identify some of your needs and determine if they are being met? The
  awareness of unmet needs will serve to "agitate" within you. If you stay present and pay attention, it will
  help focus your intentions to getting those needs met. This will help you find The Path.

step_of_the_day.title:
Take control of your life by owning your "Bulls..t." Bring your outer approach to life in alignment with
  your inner world (Pillar #1)
step_of_the_day.content:
Many years ago, I took a men's workshop called Sterling. One lesson that resonated and stuck with me was
  his discussion about a person's "bulls..t". We all have an unconscious approach or strategy when we engage
  with the outside world. We put our "best face forward", which he was referring to as our "bulls..t". His
  message was not that this was wrong or deceptive, but that it's something that everyone does. Therefore, the
  key was to own it, embrace it, be conscious of it. And ultimately accept that this is what you have
  developed (albeit unconsciously) to interact with the world, to try and get your needs met.When you embrace your approach, it avoids what typically happens, which is the feeling that you are pulling
  the wool over people's eyes. Instead it becomes a more positive experience of the outer expression of who
  you are.

action_step:
What is your "bulls..t"? What is your approach as you engage with the outside world? Do you present as a
  good fatherly or motherly figure? Do you present as a competent businessperson? Do you present as a rebel?
  Do you present as aggressive in reaching toward your goals? Pay attention and define your approach. The more
  you can own and appreciate this approach, the more effective you will be in getting your needs met. By doing
  this in a conscious way, it allows you to notice where and how it's successful and where you need to make
  adjustments.
